From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Asturian

[edit]

Verb

[edit]

disculpar (first-person singular indicative present disculpo, past participle disculpáu)

  1. alternative form of esculpar

Conjugation

[edit]

Further reading

[edit]
  • “disculpar”, in Diccionariu de la llingua asturiana [Dictionary of the Asturian Language] (in Asturian), 1ª edición, Academia de la Llingua Asturiana, 2000, →ISBN
  • Xosé Lluis García Arias (2002–2004), “disculpar”, in Diccionario general de la lengua asturiana [General Dictionary of the Asturian Language] (in Spanish), Editorial Prensa Asturiana, →ISBN

Catalan

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central, Balearic) [dis.kulˈpa]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [dis.kulˈpaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)

Verb

[edit]

disculpar (first-person singular present disculpo, first-person singular preterite disculpí, past participle disculpat)

  1. to excuse, forgive
    Synonym: perdonar
  2. (pronominal) to apologise

Conjugation

[edit]

Derived terms

[edit]
  • disculpar-se

Related terms

[edit]
  • disculpa

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From disculpa (“apology, excuse”) +‎ -ar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /diskulˈpaɾ/ [d̪is.kulˈpaɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: dis‧cul‧par

Verb

[edit]

disculpar (first-person singular present disculpo, first-person singular preterite disculpé, past participle disculpado)

  1. (transitive) to excuse, forgive, pardon
    Synonym: perdonar
  2. (reflexive) to apologize

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of disculpar (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
